TITLE: Using SELECT Function for Conditional Data Filtering in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: The SELECT function filters values from a list according to specified criteria. This is useful for displaying only data that meets certain conditions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
SELECT(@Product, @Customer Type="Distributor")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using IF Function in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: The IF function tests a condition and returns one value if true and another if false. It's recommended to nest no more than two IF functions for complex conditions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_22

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
IF(@Country="Canada",@Company Name, BLANK())
```

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
IF(AND(DATE_IN(DATE(@Date, "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss"),year,-1),@Customer Type="Direct Customer"),@Revenue, 0)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using SET Function for Variable Assignment in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: The SET function assigns values to specified variable names for use in expressions. This is particularly useful for dynamic datasources that require multiple variables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
SET ( variable names, values, expression )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using SWITCH Function in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: The SWITCH function transforms values based on matching cases, similar to a case statement. It can handle multiple cases and supports a default value with the "_default_" keyword.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_26

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
SWITCH(@Product,"Bread","BREAD","Milk",TEXT_REVERSE("Milk"),"Eggs","3","Cheese","2")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using DATASOURCE Function in Klipfolio Formulas
DESCRIPTION: The DATASOURCE function enables indirect reference to a data source field by specifying the datasource ID and a pointer to the field. It's especially useful for accessing specific sheets in Excel/Google workbooks or specific XPaths in JSON/XML datasources.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: formula
CODE:
```
DATASOURCE("7883812ca90512b23668d0ac2be4a245","B:B")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using AND Function in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: The AND function tests multiple conditions and returns true only if all conditions are true. It's often used with SELECT to filter data based on multiple criteria.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
AND(@Customer Type="Distributor", @Price Base="3.04", @Price Retail="4.79")
```

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
SELECT( @Customer Type, AND( @Country= "Canada", @Price Base= "2.34" ))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using GROUPBY Function in Klipfolio Formulas
DESCRIPTION: The GROUPBY function returns values based on a specified aggregation method so that unique values align with a parallel column. It's useful for creating aggregated views of data using various methods like SUM or JOIN.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: formula
CODE:
```
GROUPBY(@Country, @Days of Activity)
```

LANGUAGE: formula
CODE:
```
GROUPBY(@Sales Rep, @Days of Activity, Join)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using OR Function in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: The OR function returns true if at least one condition is true, otherwise returns false. It evaluates multiple conditions and succeeds if any are true.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_25

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
OR(@Customer Type="Distributor", @Country="Mexico")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using LOOKUP Function for Data Correlation in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: The LOOKUP function correlates data between two data sources by matching input values against keys and returning corresponding result values. This is particularly useful for aligning data across sub-components in visualizations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
LOOKUP (@Product, @Product, @Shipping Location)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using GROUP Function in Klipfolio Formulas
DESCRIPTION: The GROUP function groups data into unique instances and hides duplicate values. Results are returned in alphabetical order and can be used to eliminate redundant entries.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: formula
CODE:
```
GROUP (@Country)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using MAPFLAT/MAP Functions for Formula Repetition in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: The MAPFLAT/MAP functions repeat a formula or datasource reference for each value in a specified list. MAPFLAT is preferred as it supports returning multiple items per parameter while MAP returns only one item.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
MAPFLAT( values, variable name, formula)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using SPLICE Function for Array Manipulation in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: The SPLICE function modifies an array by removing elements and optionally inserting new values at a specified position. This allows for precise control over data lists.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
SPLICE(@Sales Rep, 5 , 1 , "Mariam Rama")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using DATE Function in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Converts dates specified in a given format into Unix time format. Essential for working with date/time values in Klipfolio formulas since they process dates in Unix time.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_65

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
DATE ( @Date, "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss" )
```

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
DATE("2017-04-03T04:18:38.943Z","yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Conditional Summing with SUMIF in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Uses SUMIF to sum the values in a range that meet a certain condition. It takes a list of boolean values and a list of numeric values to sum as input.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_47

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
SUMIF( @Product="Bread", @Revenue )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Summing Values with SUM in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Uses SUM to return the sum of all non-blank values in a range of data. It takes a list of numeric items as input and returns their sum.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_46

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
SUM (@Revenue)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using AVERAGEIF Function in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: The AVERAGEIF function calculates the average of numeric values that correspond to true values in a condition. Non-numeric values return as 0.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_29

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
AVERAGEIF(@Product="Milk",@Revenue)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using ARRAY Function in Klipfolio Formulas
DESCRIPTION: The ARRAY function joins single values together and returns them as a unified list of data in the specified order. It can combine data from multiple sources, such as data sources and results references.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: formula
CODE:
```
ARRAY ( @Customer Contact, @Sales Rep )
```

LANGUAGE: formula
CODE:
```
ARRAY ("Exception", @Customer Type)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Conditional Counting with COUNTIF in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Uses COUNTIF to count values that meet a specific condition. It takes a list of boolean values as input and returns the count of true values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_34

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
COUNTIF ( @Shipping location="warehouse" )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using SORT Function for Data Ordering in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: The SORT function arranges values according to a specified order (ascending, descending, numeric). It can optionally return corresponding values from another list in the sorted order.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
SORT ( @Qty, descending numeric )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using RANK Function in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: The RANK function returns the rank of each item according to the order of values in a list of data. This example uses the 'Example: Live Sales Data' data source to rank the grouped days of activity in ascending order.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_77

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
RANK(GROUP(@Days of Activity), ascending)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using COUNTDISTINCT Function in Klipfolio Formulas
DESCRIPTION: The COUNTDISTINCT function counts the number of unique items in each group. Results are returned in alphabetical order and align with the results of the GROUP function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: formula
CODE:
```
COUNTDISTINCT (@Country)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using FIRST Function in Klipfolio Formulas
DESCRIPTION: The FIRST function returns the first values in a list of data where the number of values is specified by the count parameter. It's useful for retrieving the beginning elements of a dataset.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: formula
CODE:
```
FIRST(@Company Name)
```

LANGUAGE: formula
CODE:
```
FIRST(@Company Name, 5)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using AVERAGE Function in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: The AVERAGE function calculates the arithmetic mean of numeric values, ignoring non-numeric and blank items. The decimal places can be set in the Properties panel.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_28

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
AVERAGE(@Days of Activity)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Calculating Cumulative Sums with CUMULATIVE in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Uses CUMULATIVE to calculate the cumulative sums in a list of numeric data. It takes a list of numeric items as input and returns a list of cumulative sums.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_36

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
CUMULATIVE ( @Qty )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Finding Maximum Value with MAX in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Uses MAX to return the maximum value from a list of numeric values. It takes a list of numeric values as input and returns the highest value.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_39

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
MAX( @Days of Activity )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Calculating Cumulative Differences with CUMULATIVE_DIFFERENCE in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Uses CUMULATIVE_DIFFERENCE to calculate the difference between the current and previous values from a list. It takes a list of numeric items and a first value option as input.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_37

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
CUMULATIVE_DIFFERENCE ( @Qty, Ignore first value )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Calculating Median with MEDIAN in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Uses MEDIAN to return the middle value from a list of numeric values. It takes a list of numeric values as input and returns the median value.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_40

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
MEDIAN ( @Days of Activity )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Finding Mode with MODE in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Uses MODE to return the most frequently occurring lowest value found in a list of items. It takes a list of numeric values as input and returns the mode.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_43

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
MODE ( @Days of Activity )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Finding Minimum Value with MIN in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Uses MIN to return the minimum value from a list of numeric values. It takes a list of numeric values as input and returns the lowest value.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_41

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
MIN ( @Days of Activity )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Rounding Numbers with ROUND in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Uses ROUND to return a number that is rounded to a specified number of digits. It takes a number to round and the number of digits to round to as input.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_45

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
ROUND(65.29,1)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using DATE_ADD Function in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Adds or subtracts time units to/from given date/time values in Unix time format. Supports various time units from seconds to years.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_66

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
DATE_ADD( TODAY() , day , 6 )
```

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
DATE_ADD( TODAY() , day , -6 )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Rounding Down with FLOOR in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Uses FLOOR to round numbers down to the nearest multiple of significance. It takes a list of values to round down and an optional significance parameter.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_38

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
FLOOR ( -2.5 )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using COUNT Function in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: The COUNT function returns the number of non-blank items (both numeric and text) in a data set. It's useful for calculating the number of records or entries.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_31

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
COUNT ( @Shipping location )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Counting All Values with COUNTALL in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Uses COUNTALL to count all numbers, text, and blank values in a column. It takes a list of items as input and returns a single count value.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_32

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
COUNTALL ( @Shipping location )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using REPLACE Function for Value Substitution in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: The REPLACE function substitutes items that match a specified value with another value. This allows for data normalization and cleansing within visualizations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
REPLACE(@Country,"US","USA")
```

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
REPLACE(REPLACE(@Country, "US","USA"),"Canada","CA")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Counting Blank Values with COUNTBLANK in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Uses COUNTBLANK to count all blank values in a column. It takes a list of items as input and returns a single count of blank values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_33

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
COUNTBLANK ( @Shipping location )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using SLICE Function for Data Subsetting in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: The SLICE function returns a subset of values between specified start and end positions. It's commonly used to remove row headers from data or to focus on specific segments of data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
SLICE ( @Product )
```

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
SLICE( @Product, 1, 6 )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Concatenating Text with CONCAT in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Uses CONCAT to join two or more values into one text string. It takes multiple values as input and returns them joined together as a single string.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_49

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
CONCAT(@Units, " Units")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using BETWEEN Function in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: The BETWEEN function checks if values fall within a specified numeric range (inclusive). It's useful for date ranges when dates are in Unix time format.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
BETWEEN(@Days of Activity, 5, 25)
```

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
SELECT(@Company Name ,(BETWEEN( DATE( @Date, "yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss" ) , DATE_STARTOF( TODAY(), month), (DATE_ENDOF( TODAY(), month) ))))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Concatenating Values with JOIN Function
DESCRIPTION: Combines multiple values into a single string using a specified delimiter.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_53

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
JOIN(@Product,"*")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using IN Function in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: The IN function checks if values are present in a specified set, returning true or false. It's useful for testing membership in a collection of values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
IN (@Sales Rep, "Ahmed Arthurs")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Finding Last Occurrence with LASTINDEXOF Function
DESCRIPTION: Searches for the last occurrence of specified text and returns its position.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_54

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
LASTINDEXOF(@Sales Rep, "Car")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Counting Numeric Values with COUNTNUMERIC in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Uses COUNTNUMERIC to count all numeric values in a list. It takes a list of items as input and returns the count of numeric values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_35

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
COUNTNUMERIC( @Units )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using TRUNCATE Function in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Truncates text to a specified length and optionally adds a style character. The function allows control over where the style character appears and what style to use.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_60

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
TRUNCATE("abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz", 5, "end", "ellipsis")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking String Contents with CONTAINS in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Uses CONTAINS to test each value in the haystack parameter to see if it contains the value in the needle parameter. It returns a boolean value for each item in the haystack.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_50

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
CONTAINS(@Customer Type, "Customer")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using URLENCODE Function in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Encodes plain text data to be safely used in URLs. This ensures special characters are properly encoded for URL transmission.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_63

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
URLENCODE("https://www.klipfolio.com/klipfolio-certification")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using SUBSTRING Function in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Extracts a substring from a text value, starting at a specified position and optionally ending at another position. This function is useful for extracting specific parts of text data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_57

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
SUBSTRING(@Sales Rep, 4)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using DATE_CLOSEST Function in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Finds the closest specific day of the week before or after a given date in Unix time format. Allows specifying the direction to search (forward or backward).
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_67

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
DATE_CLOSEST( "1542641280", Friday, backward )
```

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
DATEVALUE( DATE_CLOSEST( DATE( "11/18/18" , "M/d/yy" ) , Monday , backward ), "d-MMM-yyyy" )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using COUNT_DAYS Function in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Calculates the number of whole days between two dates in Unix time format. Optionally allows excluding specific days of the week or holidays from the count.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_64

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
COUNT_DAYS(1541040562, 1541818162, Sunday)
```

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
COUNT_DAYS(DATE("11/01/2018","MM/dd/yyyy"),DATE("11/10/2018","MM/dd/yyyy"), ARRAY("Sun","Sat"))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using DATE_CONVERT Function in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Converts date values from one format to another without changing to Unix time format. Useful for reformatting dates for display purposes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_68

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
DATE_CONVERT("9/11/2018", "d/M/yyyy", "MMM dd, yyyy")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Date Range Generation with DATERANGE Function
DESCRIPTION: Generates a list of dates between start and end dates in MM/dd/yyyy format.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_71

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
DATERANGE("05/01/2018","05/04/2018","MM/dd/yyyy")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Date Start Calculation with DATE_STARTOF Function
DESCRIPTION: Returns start date of week, two weeks prior, using Monday as week start.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_73

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
DATE_STARTOF(DATE(@Date,"yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss"),week ,-2 ,Monday )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using PADVALUES Function to Extend Data Lists in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: The PADVALUES function returns selected values with padding or additional values at the end. This is useful for making two lists of data the same size and ensuring data alignment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
PADVALUES(@Billing, 4, "None")
```

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
PADVALUES (@C:C, COUNTALL(@B:B)-COUNTALL(@C:C))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Date Range with YESTERDAY Function
DESCRIPTION: Generates date range between fixed date and yesterday in Unix timestamp format.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_76

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
DATERANGE(DATE("11/10/2018","MM/dd/yyyy"),YESTERDAY())
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using TRIM Function in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: The TRIM function removes specified values from a list or removes all blank values if no pattern is provided. It accepts an optional pattern parameter which is case sensitive.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
TRIM(@Shipping location)
```

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
TRIM(@Product, "Milk")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using CEILING Function in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: The CEILING function rounds numbers up to the nearest multiple of significance. Non-numeric values return as 0, and an optional significance parameter can specify the multiple to round up to.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_30

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
CEILING ( -2.5 )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Calculating Remainder with MOD in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Uses MOD to return the remainder of each value after dividing by the modulus value. It takes a list of numeric values and a divisor as input.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_42

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
MOD ( @Days of Activity, 5 )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Calculating Power with POWER in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Uses POWER to raise each base to the specified exponent. It takes a list of numeric bases and a single exponent value as input.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_44

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
POWER(20,3)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Capitalizing Text with CAPITALIZE in Klipfolio
DESCRIPTION: Uses CAPITALIZE to change the first letter in each word to uppercase. It takes a text value or values as input and returns the capitalized text.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gneius/klipfolio-functions/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_48

LANGUAGE: klipfolio
CODE:
```
CAPITALIZE ("canada")
```

----------------------------------------
